segments.content: It is widely accepted that the health benefit a patient derives from a particular health care intervention can be defined according to two natural dimensions: quality of life and quantity of life. An alternative to QALYs is the so-called productivity-adjusted life years (in short, PALYs), which are calculated by multiplying a productivity index by years lived. We conclude this introduction stressing that our model treats health and productivity as different individual attributes.

segments.content: The choice of evaluation function matters to a large extent when it comes to rank different distributions. Instead of making that choice directly based on their functional forms, we rather believe the choice should be guided by the axioms they satisfy.
